FinScript
Table of Contents

Namespace FinScript.Data

Classes

BarSeries

Represents the data returned from the historical data repository. The Bars object contain several methods and properties for working with bar data.

BarSeriesBackwardIndexer
BarSeriesProxy
IBarSeriesExtensions
PriceSeries

Represents historical bar data as an ISeries double interface which can be used for wrapping IBarSeries and extracting parts of price data from it

SeriesBackwardIndexerBase<T>

A backward indexer for indexing specified series (ISeries<T>) in reverse mode, starting from CurrentBarIndex CurrentBarIndex has index 0, previous bar has index 1 and so on up to first item in series

SeriesBackwardIndexerForLastBar

A static helper to index series in reverse mode It always works with the last bar as a current bar index (SeriesBackwardIndexerForLastBar<T>) If you need to use a custom current bar index, SeriesBackwardIndexer<T>

SeriesBackwardIndexerForLastBar<T>

Bar indexer that always works with last bar as current bar index CurrentBarIndex

SeriesBackwardIndexerWritable<T>
SeriesBackwardIndexer<T>

Standard series backward indexer which indexes all elements of IBarSeries in backward order starting from specified bar

SeriesBase<T>

Base class for ISeries<T> implementation

SeriesExtension
SeriesExtensions
Series<T>

A Series T is a special generic type of data structure that can be constructed with any chosen data type and holds a series of values equal to the same number of elements as bars in a chart

TimeSeries

Represents historical bar data as an ISeries datetime interface to get time values from IBarSeries

VolumeAsDoubleSeries

Series of volume values from bars

VolumeSeries

Series of volume values from bars

Enums

PriceType

A price of the (typically) of the bar
